title: Reveal and Launch of Procreate Dreams
heading: Procreate Dreams: Crafting our Reveal and Launch Campaign
description: I designed the reveal and launch campaigns for Procreate Dreams, introducing an all-new animation tool from the makers of Procreate to a broader audience.

nominations.text: 2024 Apple iPad App of the Year

content.title: The Challenge
text: The animation software market for iPad was already saturated with established players. In September 2023, we sought to enter this space with something truly revolutionary, unveiling a product 5 years in the making at [Playgrounds in Motion](https://weareplaygrounds.nl/in-motion-festival/) in London.

We needed to differentiate Dreams not just through its features, but through a compelling narrative that would resonate with both professional animators and beginners. We were ready to mark a historic milestone for accessible animation in the Apple ecosystem.

content.caption: Credit: hero section designed by me, motion graphic created by our design team

content.title: Anticipation
text: Our first announcement was a teaser to build excitment and anticipation for something big coming. We created an air of mystery that would capitalize on our brand's existing equity. We generated excitement through strategic silence, letting our community's imagination and trust in the Procreate name drive the conversation.

content.caption: A custom countdown animation to build anticipation and excitement

content.title: Before the Keynote in London
text: In the days leading up the reveal keynote, we created more anticipation through a countdown that I designed. This helped create much conversation in our community with many speculations about what Procreate had in store.
The campaign culminated in a save-the-date announcement for our reveal event, driving thousands of signups and social media engagement before we even showed the product.

content.title: The Keynote Reveal
text: The September 8th event at Playground London marked the culmination of our launch strategy. Our CEO James took the stage to deliver an Apple-style keynote. Our new product that boasted accessible, intuitive animation was music to the ears of our beloved creative community, and the reaction was overwhelmingly positive.

Throughout the venue, we created an interactive experience. We set up demo iPads for people to get hands-on with the product, while professional artists, including renowned Disney animator Aaron Blaise, did live demonstrations to showcase the incredible possibilities of Dreams.

images.alt: Procreate Dreams image made for iPad
Procreate Dreams hero image showing the app interface

content.title: No subscriptions
text: We announced Dreams' one-time price of $19.99. No subscriptions. The crowd responded very positively to our decision to stay true to Procreate's philosophy that professionals should own their creative tools without recurring fees. This approach has always resonated with our community and shows our commitment to putting artists first.

content.caption: A moment of surprise when my render was shown in front of my millions.

content.title: After the reveal
text: In preparation for the product launch that was two months away on Nov 22, 2023, I designed a new comprehensive [Help Center](https://help.procreate.com) to ensure our users had all the resources they needed. We also updated our marketing site to highlight Dreams' groundbreaking features: real-time rendering for instant animation feedback, a subscription-free model with only a one-time purchase, and the introduction of video and audio capabilities to the Procreate ecosystem.
We built a pre-order campaign and invited users to celebrate with us that the Procreate experience they know and love has entered the world of animation.

content.caption: Video and audio introduced to the Procreate ecosystem
A crucial selling point for traditional Adobe users

text: Our target customers included both animation newcomers and seasoned professionals, with a bias towards the prosumer. Our belief will always be that [art is for everyone](https://procreate.com/who-we-are).

I designed our marketing page with a vision of less-is-more. I focused on capturing specific moments in the app where simplicity shined. To demonstrate Procreate Dreams' diverse capabilities, we commissioned and curated artwork from many talented animators. I designed compositions in a way that best complemented each artwork's strengths and highlighted a specific feature, showcasing how the app could adapt to any level of fidelity, style, or industry.

images.alt: Procreate Dreams image made for iPad

content.caption: A selection of artworks commissioned and curated to showcase the diverse capabilities of Procreate Dreams

content.title: Results
text: After months of anticipation, we finally released Procreate Dreams in November. The launch exceeded our expectations with over 150k first-time downloads and more than 80k pre-orders. Our website saw close to 20k visits during the reveal and 63k visits on launch day. This success culminated in receiving the [Apple Design Award for Innovation in 2024](https://www.apple.com/au/newsroom/2024/06/apple-announces-winners-of-the-2024-apple-design-awards/) and was also nominated for [2024 iPad App of the Year](https://developer.apple.com/app-store/app-store-awards-2024/), recognizing our efforts to make professional animation tools more accessible.

content.caption: The 2024 Apple Design Award for Innovation
